title: create-sibling analysis if remote dataset exist is flawed if super-ds was pushed before (nested layout only)
body:
ATM it just checks if a directory (or a file for that sake) corresponding to the subdataset exists on remote side, and if not -- silently(**!**) skips (actually first says "Creating... ;)") without doing anything.  If we push a new state of the super dataset first, it (git?) creates empty subdirectory for it, so path "exists" and thus either causes Error or gets skipped:
```shell
hopa:/tmp/test
$> builtin cd /tmp; rm -rf test test-target; datalad create test; cd test; datalad create-sibling -s test-target localhost:/tmp/test-target; datalad publish --to=test-target ; datalad create -d . sub; datalad publish --to=test-target; datalad create-sibling -s test-target -r --existing=skip localhost:/tmp/test-target
...
[INFO   ] Publishing <Dataset path=/tmp/test> to test-target 
[INFO   ] Publishing data of dataset <Dataset path=/tmp/test> ... 
1 item was published:
Dataset: /tmp/test

[INFO   ] Skipping dataset with an already configured sibling 'test-target': ['/tmp/test'] 
[INFO   ] Connecting ... 
[INFO   ] Creating target dataset /tmp/test/sub at /tmp/test-target/sub 
(dev) 2 12112.....................................:Tue 14 Feb 2017 03:54:33 PM EST:.
hopa:/tmp/test
$> ls /tmp/test-target 
sub/
(dev) 2 12113.....................................:Tue 14 Feb 2017 03:54:48 PM EST:.
hopa:/tmp/test
$> ls -a /tmp/test-target/sub
./  ../
```
so as you can see -- empty directory remains, no remote sibling is actually created.  datalad -- current master 0.4.1-460-gc3c52a9c .  will submit a quick PR addressing it
